purpleculture_examples:
游泳 [ yóu yǒng ]: swimming; to swim
自由泳 [ zì yóu yǒng ]: freestyle swimming
游泳池 [ yóu yǒng chí ]: swimming pool; Classifiers: 场
蛙泳 [ wā yǒng ]: breaststroke (swimming)
混合泳 [ hùn hé yǒng ]: medley (swimming)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 永 [ yǒng ] long; perpetual, eternal; forever
heisig_chinese_memo: You'll be in the water for an eternity if you can't swim!
heisig_constituent: swim, water, water droplets, water pistol, eternity
heisig_story: The primitive to the left, you will recall from Frame 137, represents water. To the right, we see the kanji for eternity. Knowing how much children like swimming, what could be a better image of eternal bliss than an endless expanse of water to swim in without a care in the world?
koohiiStory1: With that much WATER (2 actually) you would need to swim for an ETERNITY.
koohiiStory2: If you don´t know how to swim, you´ll be in that water for eternity.
jp_example_words:
泳ぎ(およぎ): swimming
水泳(すいえい): swimming
泳ぐ(およぐ): swim
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If a tsunami is going to last an eternity you better learn how to swim now. We'll be under water for the rest of time and if you can't swim you're not gonna make it.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture most of the earth's population already swimming on the tsunami that will last the rest of eternity. Your floaties and life preservers would help you through this mess. You need to swim!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Oy (およ)! Oy, stop daydreaming about swimming and actually do it!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture yourself swimming in the tsunami with everyone else. You can't really talk to them, you're too busy swimming for your life, so you just shout "Oy!" to them and they shout it back.
Ru_Notes: Фонетик и не путать: 永 (ながい、エイ вечный). Не путать: 水 (みず、スイ вода), 氷 (こおり、ヒョウ лёд).
Kanshudo_mnemonic: if you're in the water (氵) a long time (永) you'd better swim
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You'll be in the water for an eternity if you can't swim!
origin_of_ch_char_book: The Yellow River that flows through China is one of the longest rivers in the world. The river is so long that the ancient Chinese probably thought that it was endless. Therefore, a long river’s endless flow came to mean “forever”. (永, yong, forever) was created to mean such thoughts. The character shows a person (人, ren, human), a road (行, xing=hsing, line), and a flow of water . It signifies a man swimming in the river: (泳, yong, swim) or walking next to a river. He would think the river is so long, and the flow of water is endless.

origin_of_ch_char_book: The Yellow River that flows through China is one of the longest rivers in the world. The river is so long that the ancient Chinese probably thought that it was endless. Therefore, a long river’s endless flow came to mean “forever”. (永, yong, forever) was created to mean such thoughts. The character shows a person (人, ren, human), a road (行, xing=hsing, line), and a flow of water . It signifies a man swimming in the river: (泳, yong, swim) or walking next to a river. He would think the river is so long, and the flow of water is endless.

泳字的基本解释

泳
yǒng
在水里游动：游泳。蛙泳。仰泳。

泳字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yǒng］
［《廣韻》爲命切，去映，云。］
潜行于水中；浮游。

泳字的英文翻译

◎ 泳
swim

泳字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　泳； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页619第02
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?爲命切，音詠。【說文】潛行水中也。【爾雅·釋言】泳，游也。【詩·邶風】泳之游之。　又【韻補】叶虛誑切，音旺。【詩·周南】漢之廣矣，不可泳思。江之永矣，不可方思。方去聲。

泳字的源字形

泳字的起名意思

：指在水里游动。

Source glyph
swimming
Name meaning
: Refers to swimming in the water.
泳
形声字。水(氵)表意,篆书形体像一道河水,表示在水中潜行为泳;永(yong)表声,永有长久义,表示在水下潜游比在
水上浮游速度慢,所需时间长。本义是潜泳,泛指游泳。
游泳:~装|蛙~「冬~。
~道 侧~ 蝶~ 爬~ 潜~ 仰~ 游~ 游~池
yŏng
都|泳|泳
隶
плавание
Пиктофонетические символы.
Вода (氵) означает, что сценарий тюленя похож на речную воду, что означает плавание в воде; Ён (yong) означает, что он всегда будет иметь долгое значение, что означает, что подводное плавание медленнее, чем плавание по воде, и занимает больше времени. .
Первоначальное значение - снорклинг, в основном относится к плаванию.
Плавание: ~ Платье | Лягушка ~ "Зима ~".
~ Обочина дороги ~ Бабочка ~ Скалолазание ~ Дайвинг ~ Восход ~ Плавание ~ Плавание ~ Бассейн
молодой
Все | плавание | плавание
писец
yǒng
I гл.
плавать; плыть; передвигаться по (в) воде
泳之游之 по ней (по воде, реке) шла вброд иль вплавь пускалась
II сущ.
пекинск. диал. плавание; погружение в воду; ныряние; нахождение в воде
游了一天泳 проплавал целый день

泳

Значения

Плавать

Мнемоника

  • Находиться на воде 氵 долго 永, значит, плыть, а не тонуть.

  • "Я плаваю по воде."
Radicals: 氵, 永  (tsunami, eternity)
Meaning Mnemonic
If a tsunami is going to last an eternity you better learn how to swim now. We'll be under water for the rest of time and if you can't swim you're not gonna make it.
Picture most of the earth's population already swimming on the tsunami that will last the rest of eternity. Your floaties and life preservers would help you through this mess. You need to swim!
Reading Mnemonic
Oy (およ)! Oy, stop daydreaming about swimming and actually do it!
Picture yourself swimming in the tsunami with everyone else. You can't really talk to them, you're too busy swimming for your life, so you just shout "Oy!" to them and they shout it back.
